page.title: 17 Amenities in Radcot area
page.content: Being a scattered rural community there is a definite lack of amenities in this area. Mains electricity, TV and telephone services are available but there is no piped gas supply, no mains water or mains drainage. The farmers have to pump water from their own wells and pipe it to their farm cottages. The public house is supplied by one of the farm systems. Each farm has to make its own arrangements for sewage disposal. There are three post boxes serving the area, two along the main road, one in a countrylane. The only meeting place is the public house. For visits to the doctor, shopping, entertainment etc. it is necessary to go to a nearby village or town. Although Faringdon is the nearer town people prefer to shop in Carterton, enjoying a trip to the weekly Thursday market.
